SEARCH
Module com.example.rupizzeria
Package com.example.rupizzeria

Class Order

java.lang.Object
com.example.rupizzeria.Order
public class Order extends Object
Represents an order, which contains a unique order number and a list of pizzas. Handles calculations for the order's subtotal, tax, and total.
Since:
2024-11-17
Author:
Pranav Chundi

  • Constructor Details

    • Order

      public Order()
      Constructor for the Order class. This initializes a new order with a unique order number and an empty list of pizzas. Each order is automatically assigned a sequential order number using a static counter, ensuring that every order is uniquely identifiable.

  • Method Details

    • getOrderNumber

      public int getOrderNumber()
      Retrieves the unique order number for this order. This number is automatically assigned when the order is created and is used to distinguish it from other orders.
      Returns:
      The unique order number.

    • getPizzas

      public ArrayList<Pizza> getPizzas()
      Retrieves the list of pizzas in this order. This allows access to all pizzas currently added to the order for further operations like modifying, displaying, or calculating totals.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing the pizzas in this order.

    • addPizza

      public void addPizza(Pizza pizza)
      Adds a pizza to the order.
      Parameters:
      pizza - The pizza to add.

    • removePizza

      public void removePizza(Pizza pizza)
      Removes a pizza from the order.
      Parameters:
      pizza - The pizza to remove.

    • calculateSubtotal

      public double calculateSubtotal()
      Calculates the subtotal of the order by summing the prices of all pizzas.
      Returns:
      The subtotal of the order.

    • calculateTax

      public double calculateTax()
      Calculates the tax for the order based on the subtotal.
      Returns:
      The tax amount for the order.

    • calculateTotal

      public double calculateTotal()
      Calculates the total cost of the order, including tax.
      Returns:
      The total cost of the order.

    • roundToTwoDecimals

      private double roundToTwoDecimals(double value)
      Rounds a given double value to two decimal places. This is particularly useful for ensuring monetary values are displayed accurately, without unnecessary precision.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to be rounded.
      Returns:
      The value rounded to two decimal places.

    • formatCurrency

      private String formatCurrency(double amount)
      Formats a given monetary value into a currency string. The output includes a dollar sign and two decimal places for a clean and professional display. Example: A value of 12.5 will be formatted as "$12.50".
      Parameters:
      amount - The monetary value to be formatted.
      Returns:
      A string representing the formatted currency value.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the order, including all pizzas and the total cost.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The order details as a string.
